trans-unit.source: The container interface supports get and init methods. init is a async compatible method that is called with one argument: the shared scope object. This object is used as a shared scope in the remote container and is filled with the provided modules from a host. It can be leveraged to connect remote containers to a host container dynamically at runtime.

The container tries to provide shared modules, but if the shared module has already been used, a warning and the provided shared module will be ignored. The container might still use it as a fallback.

The container will manage overridable modules in a way that they do not need to be downloaded when they have been overridden by the consumer. This usually happens by placing them into separate chunks.
The content of the dll is accessible under a module prefix. i.e. with scope = "xyz" a file abc in the dll can be access via require("xyz/abc").
trans-unit.target: Se puede acceder al contenido de la dll con un prefijo de módulo. es decir, con scope = "xyz" se puede acceder a un archivo abc en la dll a través de require("xyz/abc") .

Utilice el cargador de archivos para emitir el resultado del cargador de extracción como un archivo separado.

trans-unit.source: The extract-loader works similar to the extract-text-webpack-plugin and is meant as a lean alternative to it. While this plugin is useful during development for more readable output, it does take a bit longer to run. The second option is the HashedModuleIdsPlugin, which is recommended for production builds:

Si bien este complemento es útil durante el desarrollo para obtener una salida más legible, tarda un poco más en ejecutarse. La segunda opción es HashedModuleIdsPlugin , que se recomienda para compilaciones de producción:

trans-unit.source: The goals of development and production builds differ greatly. In development, we want strong source mapping and a localhost server with live reloading or hot module replacement. In production, our goals shift to a focus on minified bundles, lighter weight source maps, and optimized assets to improve load time. With this logical separation at hand, we typically recommend writing separate webpack configurations for each environment.
trans-unit.target: Los objetivos de las construcciones de desarrollo y producción son muy diferentes. En desarrollo , queremos un mapeo de fuentes sólido y un servidor localhost con recarga en vivo o reemplazo de módulo en caliente. En producción , nuestros objetivos se centran en paquetes minificados, mapas de origen más livianos y activos optimizados para mejorar el tiempo de carga. Con esta separación lógica a mano, normalmente recomendamos escribir configuraciones de paquetes web independientes para cada entorno.

trans-unit.source: The good news for web projects is that modules are becoming an official feature in the ECMAScript standard. However, browser support is incomplete and bundling is still faster and currently recommended over these early module implementations.

The good news is that, while there is some overlap, task runners and bundlers can play well together if approached in the right way. This guide provides a high-level overview of how webpack can be integrated into some of the more popular task runners.
trans-unit.target: La buena noticia es que,aunque hay cierta superposición,los corredores de tareas y los empaquetadores pueden jugar bien juntos si se les acerca de la manera correcta.Esta guía proporciona una visión general de alto nivel de cómo el webpack puede integrarse en algunos de los task runners más populares.

trans-unit.source: The runtime code detects already added CSS via <link> or <style> tag. This can be useful when injecting CSS on server-side for Server-Side-Rendering. The href of the <link> tag has to match the URL that will be used for loading the CSS chunk. The data-href attribute can be used for <link> and <style> too. When inlining CSS data-href must be used.
trans-unit.target: El código de tiempo de ejecución detecta CSS ya agregado a través de la etiqueta <link> o <style> . Esto puede resultar útil al inyectar CSS en el lado del servidor para la representación del lado del servidor. El href de la etiqueta <link> tiene que coincidir con la URL que se utilizará para cargar el fragmento de CSS. El atributo data-href también se puede utilizar para <link> y <style> . Cuando se inserta CSS data-href debe usar data-href .

trans-unit.source: The runtime, along with the manifest data, is basically all the code webpack needs to connect your modularized application while it's running in the browser. It contains the loading and resolving logic needed to connect your modules as they interact. This includes connecting modules that have already been loaded into the browser as well as logic to lazy-load the ones that haven't.

trans-unit.source: The webpack 2 release came with built-in support for ES2015 modules (alias harmony modules) as well as unused module export detection. The new webpack 4 release expands on this capability with a way to provide hints to the compiler via the "sideEffects"package.json property to denote which files in your project are "pure" and therefore safe to prune if unused.
trans-unit.target: La versión webpack 2 vino con soporte integrado para módulos ES2015 ( módulos de armonía de alias ), así como detección de exportación de módulos no utilizados. La nueva versión del paquete web 4 amplía esta capacidad con una forma de proporcionar sugerencias al compilador a través de la "sideEffects" package.json para indicar qué archivos de su proyecto son "puros" y, por lo tanto, seguros de eliminar si no se utilizan.

trans-unit.source: There are a few use cases in real applications where this feature becomes especially neat. Essentially, every file emitted to your output.path directory will be referenced from the output.publicPath location. This includes child chunks (created via code splitting) and any other assets (e.g. images, fonts, etc.) that are a part of your dependency graph.
trans-unit.target: Hay algunos casos de uso en aplicaciones reales en los que esta característica se vuelve especialmente interesante. Esencialmente, cada archivo emitido a su directorio output.path será referenciado desde la ubicación output.publicPath . Esto incluye fragmentos secundarios (creados mediante la división de código ) y cualquier otro activo (por ejemplo, imágenes, fuentes, etc.) que son parte de su gráfico de dependencia.

There are two ways to run JavaScript in a browser. First, include a script for each functionality; this solution is hard to scale because loading too many scripts can cause a network bottleneck. The second option is to use a big .js file containing all your project code, but this leads to problems in scope, size, readability and maintainability.

There has been a performance regression in the latest stable versions of Node.js and its ES2015 Map and Set implementations. A fix has been merged in master, but a release has yet to be made. In the meantime, to get the most out of incremental build speeds, try to stick with version 8.9.x (problem exists between 8.9.10 - 9.11.1). webpack has moved to using those ES2015 data structures liberally, and it will improve the initial build times as well.
trans-unit.target: Ha habido una regresión de rendimiento en las últimas versiones estables de Node.js y sus implementaciones de Map y Set ES2015 . Se ha fusionado una solución en master, pero aún no se ha publicado una versión. Mientras tanto, para aprovechar al máximo las velocidades de compilación incrementales, intente seguir con la versión 8.9.x (el problema existe entre la 8.9.10 y la 9.11.1). webpack ha pasado a utilizar esas estructuras de datos ES2015 de forma liberal, y también mejorará los tiempos de compilación iniciales.

trans-unit.source: This loader is especially useful when using 3rd-party libraries having their own source maps. If not extracted and processed into the source map of the webpack bundle, browsers may misinterpret source map data. source-map-loader allows webpack to maintain source map data continuity across libraries so ease of debugging is preserved.
trans-unit.target: Este cargador es especialmente útil cuando se utilizan bibliotecas de terceros que tienen sus propios mapas de origen. Si no se extrae y procesa en el mapa de origen del paquete webpack, los navegadores pueden malinterpretar los datos del mapa de origen. source-map-loader permite que el paquete web mantenga la continuidad de los datos del mapa de origen en las bibliotecas, por lo que se conserva la facilidad de depuración.

trans-unit.source: This small library is a core utility in webpack but can also be used elsewhere to provide a similar plugin interface. Many objects in webpack extend the Tapable class. The class exposes tap, tapAsync, and tapPromise methods which plugins can use to inject custom build steps that will be fired throughout a compilation.
trans-unit.target: Esta pequeña biblioteca es una utilidad principal en el paquete web, pero también se puede usar en otros lugares para proporcionar una interfaz de complemento similar. Muchos objetos del paquete web amplían la clase Tapable . La clase expone los métodos tap , tapAsync y tapPromise que los complementos pueden usar para inyectar pasos de compilación personalizados que se activarán a lo largo de una compilación.

trans-unit.target: Esta sintaxis se utiliza para describir todas las formas posibles en que una biblioteca externa puede estar disponible. lodash aquí está disponible como lodash en los sistemas de módulos AMD y CommonJS, pero está disponible como _ en una forma de variable global. subtract aquí está disponible a través de la propiedad subtract bajo el objeto math global (por ejemplo, window['math']['subtract'] ).

Toggle between the dev-server's two different modes. By default the application will be served with inline mode enabled. This means that a script will be inserted in your bundle to take care of live reloading, and build messages will appear in the browser console.
trans-unit.target: Alternar entre los dos modos diferentes del servidor de desarrollo. De forma predeterminada, la aplicación se servirá con el modo en línea habilitado. Esto significa que se insertará un script en su paquete para encargarse de la recarga en vivo, y los mensajes de compilación aparecerán en la consola del navegador.

trans-unit.source: Toggle between the dev-server's two different modes. By default, the application will be served with inline mode enabled. This means that a script will be inserted in your bundle to take care of live reloading, and build messages will appear in the browser console.

trans-unit.source: Treat NW.js legacy nw.gui module as external and load it via require() when used.
Treat common electron built-in modules in main and preload context like electron, ipc or shell as external and load them via require() when used.
Treat electron built-in modules in the main context like app, ipc-main or shell as external and load them via require() when used.
Treat electron built-in modules in the preload context like web-frame, ipc-renderer or shell as external and load them via require() when used.
Treat electron built-in modules in the renderer context like web-frame, ipc-renderer or shell as external and load them via require() when used.
Treat node.js built-in modules like fs, path or vm as external and load them via require() when used.
Treat references to 'http(s)://...' and 'std:...' as external and load them via async import() when used (Note that this external type is an async module, which has various effects on the execution).
Treat references to http(s)://... and std:... as external and load them via async import() when used (Note that this external type is an async module, which has various effects on the execution).
Treat references to http(s)://... and std:... as external and load them via import when used. (Note that this changes execution order as externals are executed before any other code in the chunk).

trans-unit.source: Turns hints on/off. In addition, tells webpack to throw either an error or a warning when hints are found.
Turns hints on/off. In addition, tells webpack to throw either an error or a warning when hints are found. This property is set to "warning" by default.

trans-unit.source: Two chunk groups with names home and about are created. Each of them has a chunk with a module - ./home.js for home and ./about.js for about

Two similar techniques are supported by webpack when it comes to dynamic code splitting. The first and recommended approach is to use the import() syntax that conforms to the ECMAScript proposal for dynamic imports. The legacy, webpack-specific approach is to use require.ensure. Let's try using the first of these two approaches...
trans-unit.target: Webpack admite dos técnicas similares cuando se trata de la división dinámica de código. El primer enfoque recomendado es utilizar la sintaxis import() que se ajuste a la propuesta de ECMAScript para importaciones dinámicas. El enfoque heredado específico del paquete web es utilizar require.ensure . Intentemos usar el primero de estos dos enfoques ...

trans-unit.source: Two similar techniques are supported by webpack when it comes to dynamic code splitting. The first and recommended approach is to use the import() syntax that conforms to the ECMAScript proposal for dynamic imports. The legacy, webpack-specific approach is to use require.ensure. Let's try using the first of these two approaches...
